heliolib.data_standardization_service.timestream_data_reindexer.timestream_data_reindexer module

class heliolib.data_standardization_service.timestream_data_reindexer.timestream_data_reindexer.Reindexer[source]

Bases: object

Responsible for reindexing a pandas DataFrame to a specified target frequency.

The Reindexer class provides functionality to either upsample or downsample a given DataFrame based on a specified frequency, handling the time zone consistency and validation of input data.

Methods:

create_target_index(start_time, end_time, freq):

Creates a target datetime index with the specified frequency.

run_reindexer(dataframe, target_freq):

Reindexes the given dataframe to the target frequency.

Raises:

Exception:

If validation of the target frequency fails.

Examples:

reindexer = Reindexer() reindexed_df = reindexer.run_reindexer(df, pd.Timedelta(minutes=5))

static create_target_index(start_time, end_time, target_freq)[source]

Creates a target datetime index based on the start time, end time, and frequency.

Parameters:

start_timedatetime

The start time of the target index.

end_timedatetime

The end time of the target index.

target_freqpd.Timedelta

The frequency for the target index.

Returns:

pd.DatetimeIndex

A DatetimeIndex with the specified frequency within the given time range.

run_reindexer(dataframe: DataFrame, target_freq: Timedelta) → DataFrame[source]

Reindex the dataframe to the target frequency.

Parameters:

dataframepd.DataFrame

The dataframe to be resampled.

target_freqpd.Timedelta

The target frequency for resampling.

Returns:

pd.DataFrame

The resampled dataframe.

Raises:

Exception

If validation of the target frequency fails or other resampling issues occur.
